first_reading.title: Book of Exodus
first_reading.text:
[[Ex 40,16]]Moses did exactly as the LORD had commanded him.
[[Ex 40,17]]On the first day of the first month of the second year the Dwelling was erected.
[[Ex 40,18]]It was Moses who erected the Dwelling. He placed its pedestals, set up its boards, put in its bars, and set up its columns.
[[Ex 40,19]]He spread the tent over the Dwelling and put the covering on top of the tent, as the LORD had commanded him.
[[Ex 40,20]]He took the commandments and put them in the ark; he placed poles alongside the ark and set the propitiatory upon it.
[[Ex 40,21]]He brought the ark into the Dwelling and hung the curtain veil, thus screening off the ark of the commandments, as the LORD had commanded him.
[[Ex 40,34]]Then the cloud covered the meeting tent, and the glory of the LORD filled the Dwelling.
[[Ex 40,35]]Moses could not enter the meeting tent, because the cloud settled down upon it and the glory of the LORD filled the Dwelling.
[[Ex 40,36]]Whenever the cloud rose from the Dwelling, the Israelites would set out on their journey.
[[Ex 40,37]]But if the cloud did not lift, they would not go forward; only when it lifted did they go forward.
[[Ex 40,38]]In the daytime the cloud of the LORD was seen over the Dwelling; whereas at night, fire was seen in the cloud by the whole house of Israel in all the stages of their journey.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 84,3]]My soul yearns and pines 
for the courts of the LORD. 
My heart and my flesh 
cry out for the living God.

[[Ps 84,4]]Even the sparrow finds a home, 
and the swallow a nest 
in which she puts her young? 
Your altars, O LORD of hosts, 
my king and my God!

[[Ps 84,5]]Blessed are they who dwell in your house! 
Continually they praise you.
[[Ps 84,6a]]Blessed the men whose strength you are!
[[Ps 84,8a]]They go from strength to strength.

[[Ps 84,11]]I had rather one day in your courts 
than a thousand elsewhere; 
I had rather lie at the threshold of the house of my God 
than dwell in the tents of the wicked.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 13,47]]Jesus said to the disciples: â€œThe Kingdom of heaven is like a net thrown into the sea, which collects fish of every kind.
[[Mt 13,48]]When it is full they haul it ashore and sit down to put what is good into buckets. What is bad they throw away.
[[Mt 13,49]]Thus it will be at the end of the age. The angels will go out and separate the wicked from the righteous
[[Mt 13,50]]and throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be wailing and grinding of teeth.
[[Mt 13,51]]Do you understand all these things? They answered, "Yes."
[[Mt 13,52]]And he replied, "Then every scribe who has been instructed in the kingdom of heaven is like the head of a household who brings from his storeroom both the new and the old."
[[Mt 13,53]]When Jesus finished these parables, he went away from there.
